attributes.action: Amend the Human Rights Act to support informed public debate.
attributes.background: Only when we have a clear view of issues can we make informed choice, people cannot make functional choices when they do not know what they are choosing. It should be an offence for those in public office to provide misleading, inaccurate or untruthful information that obfuscates public debate.
attributes.additional_details: I propose an additional article under the UK Human Rights Act which prevents the dumbing down and obfuscation of public debate. It is the duty of public servants to bring clarity and accuracy to public debate to establish objectives and clean information both pro and con. It should be an offence for those in public office to provide misleading, inaccurate or untruthful information that obfuscates public debate.

attributes.action: Have better support for people with learning disabilities in schools
attributes.background: Aa someone who has learning disabilities I feel like I havent had enough support.

attributes.action: Hold a second Brexit referendum in 2 years so that more young voters have a say.
attributes.background: Article 50 means that we do not formally leave the EU for at least two years. During this time a large number of 16-17 year olds will become eligible to vote. The government will not lower the voting age, but we should allow eligible youngsters to decide either way on their future.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament should also consider working with the youth parliament and implementing a way of allowing them to have a say on their future.

attributes.action: New EU referendum should Scotland leave the UK and break the Union.
attributes.background: This petition calls for a suspension of any action for an exit from the EU until the issue of Scottish independance is resolved. If Scotland leave and the UK breaks up then a new question would need to be posed, reflecting the nature of the change, the original question becoming invalid.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition aims for Parliament to consider and plan through any serious changes that may result from Scottish independance and the impact this would have on the recent referendum result and mindset of the voting public.

The original referendum question posed was for the United Kingdom exiting the EU, should Scotland gain independance then the UK breaks up and the question is void, given the change of circumstances.

attributes.action: Put more funding towards schools and other public services.
attributes.background: Public services such as schools and the NHS are not very well funded. After leaving the EU, we will be apparently saving Â£350 million a week. Some of this money should go to public services.

attributes.action: Allow the City and Greater London to join the EU
attributes.background: Given the EU referendum result showed a large discrepancy of opinion between those voting in London and those voting in England and Wales, we would like to initiate proceedings for the City and Greater London to join the EU.

attributes.action: A new referendum: Leave the EU now or in 2036 (subject to a further referendum)?
attributes.background: We have voted to leave the EU which is irreversible. We now need a referendum to ascertain whether we leave the EU now or in 20 years' time (subject to a further referendum, of course)?
attributes.additional_details: The EU is not perfect and will probably be subject to some kind of reform in the coming decades. This additional referendum is to find out if the UK population would like postpone our exit pending any changes that may occur within the union.

attributes.action: Provide a way to account for children's opinion on issues affecting their future
attributes.background: 14 million under 18s live in the UK and aren't able to vote. According to Unicef they have the right for their views to be heard and respected. When important debates are taking place, directly affecting their future, we propose that their opinions should be officially collated by Government.
attributes.additional_details:
.UN Convention on the Rights of the Child, Article 12 (respect for the views of the child) and Article 13 (freedom of expression).
.Improving the Spiritual, Moral, Social and Cultural (SMSC) development of pupils: Departmental advice for independent schools, academies and free schools (DfE November 2013, p5)
.Section 78 of the Education Act 2002
.UNICEF- Promoting Children's Participation in Democratic Decision Making (Gerison Lansdown, UNICEF Innocenti Research Centre, ISBN: 88-85401-73-2)

attributes.action: Trans issues should be taught as part of Personal, Social and Health Education
attributes.background: Trans issues should be taught as part of Personal, Social and Health Education. Also, Gender-variant young people should get sufficient support at school. Schools need to understand their responsibilities under the Equality Act 2010 and must ensure all staff receive training.
attributes.additional_details: The House of Commons Women and Equalities Committee published a report in January 2016 with regards to Transgender Equality. Within this report it was established that more needs to be done to ensure that gender-variant young people receive support in school. the Equality and Human Rights Commission stated that research shows that 91% of trans boys and 66% of trans girls experience harassment or bullying at school, leading to depression, isolation and the desire to leave education.

attributes.action: Make smoking a criminal offence
attributes.background: Smoking is the biggest cause of premature deaths in the UK. Cigarette smoke contains around 4,000 chemicals, among which are over 50 known carcinogens. It is clear smoking needs to be stopped. By making smoking illegal it provides smokers with an incentive; quit or face charges.
attributes.additional_details: Smoking kills around 100,000 per year. Some of the cancers caused by smoking include lung, mouth, larynx, oesophagus and leukaemia to name just a few. Other problems can include heart disease, dementia, pulmonary fibrosis and gum disease. Smoking needs to be stopped right now. And if making it illegal is the only way, so be it. Sign now and create a healthier nation for the sake of a family member you might know who smokes. If smoking is made illegal, it could save the life of someone you know.

attributes.action: Form an emergency government made of leaders of each major political party
attributes.background:
This emergency government will be responsible for negotiating the exit from the EU.
Nominated leaders from each major political party will join together to negotiate so that every member of the public will be represented, and not just those who voted for a particular individual party.

attributes.action: Make Bristol an independent city state to rejoin the European Union.
attributes.background: The majority of Bristol voted to remain in the EU.  Lets make our vote count!

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on Greater London becoming an independent, EU member state
attributes.background: We want a referendum held in Greater London on becoming an independent, federal state, that will remain a member of the European Union. This reflects the wishes of the majority of Londoners to remain in the EU
attributes.additional_details: The referendum on the 23rd of June clearly showed a divide in the beliefs of Londoners and the majority of the rest of England. Continued membership of the EU is vital if London is to remain the biggest financial centre in Europe. In addition, leaving would clearly go against the wishes of the majority of Londoners. We also believe that a divorce from the UK would be less traumatic than a split from the 450 million strong EU population

attributes.action: Make June 22nd a national holiday, in tribute to Jo Cox. Cox's Day
attributes.background: Request an annual holiday as a reminder of Jo Cox and inspirational work and influence on peace and human rights. Hate will never win #moreincommon

attributes.action: Change the law on Historic Sexual abuse and assault cases and penalties
attributes.background: If a historic sexual abuse/assault case is brought before a court, if the case occurred earlier than 2003 a person prosecuted of the crime has a penalty or prison sentence which refers to the law under that point in time. All historic cases should use the current sentencing for historic cases also
attributes.additional_details: The current cases means that someone who abused someone in 1970's or 1980's only allows a person to be prosecuted under the laws of that time undermining the sentencing of someone who may have committed abhorent crimes against people, this would allow a better and more efficient way to proscute historical sexual crimes.

attributes.action: All licenced bars and clubs should have a breathalyser to prevent drink driving
attributes.background: This petition is to ask the government to make all licenced bars and clubs which serve alcohol to have breathalysers at hand for patrons to use if in control of a vehicle. This would minimise the risks associated with driving over the drink drive limit and would inturn reduce drink drive fatalities.

attributes.action: Protect identities of those subject to unsubstantiated allegations of sex abuse
attributes.background:
Several big name celebrities have been accused of historic sex abuse  their identities released to the public domain before any of the unsubstantiated allegations have been investigated.
I want to see a change in the law that protects the identity of these persons until charged with any offences.

attributes.action: Urge the US to ban assault rifles being available outside of the military
attributes.background: After recent shootings in America, I believe we need to stop military grade weaponry being available to people outside of the military. Did you know people on the terrorist watch list in American can buy assault rifles! This needs to stop. Let's not lose any people anymore.

attributes.action: require crowdfunding web to list all companys that failed after taking funding
attributes.background:
i do invest regular on crowdfunding websites but i find that the platforms hide this info to get more investors invest money in start ups 
they just advertise the succes storry and hide the failed companys i recently asked a list of all failed companys from a crowdfunding platforms but was refused

attributes.action: Turn off traffic lights for ALL roundabouts outside of peak times.
attributes.background: I drive for a living (as a service engineer) and cover about 25k annually. I am also qualified HGV1 and Motorcyle licence holder. I was a Combat driver in the TA and have also driven articulated commercial vehicles.
attributes.additional_details: The menace of traffic lights on roundabouts is a constant theme of irritation and disbelief amongst the drivers I have spoken with. Many actually ignore them late at night and risk a prosecution rather than adhere to the Highway Code. Additionally, I live near a large motorway access road junction (M27 J8.) The roundabout at the top of the slip road always flows better when the lights breakdown. I have seen this on a few occasions. I drive this roundabout continually to and from work.

attributes.action: Increase the speed limit on roads for vans or put up speed road sign for vans.
attributes.background: When driving a transit type van the national speed limit  is lower for vans than cars. Speed signs are displayed for cars but not vans. Most van drivers also drive a car so it can be confusing when there are no speed respeater signs for vans. Van technology has improved making them safer.

attributes.action: Care homes to be required by law to provide Mario Kart gaming for residents.
attributes.background: This petition was started by a medical student who recently attended an Elderly Medicine placement in Derbyshire. In many Local Authority owned care homes, residents would be sat passively in front of the lounge television screen. Residents may enjoy a competitive, interactive activity instead.
attributes.additional_details: "When groups of generally healthy medical patients aged 50 and over were instructed to play a video game that increased in difficulty and complexity with each new level, researchers at the University of Iowa found that they gained years of cognitive processing improvement after one year of play." Lynn, Kecia (2015). More Proof That Elderly People Should Play More Video Games. Big Think. http://bigthink.com/ideafeed/more-proof-that-elderly-people-should-play-more-video-games

attributes.action: Introduce basic income in the UK for every citizen whether they work or not.
attributes.background: I believe that if everyone receives a basic income, whether they are working or not, it will make citizens feel more equal.
attributes.additional_details: We really do need this proposal to go ahead because there are so many people that are homeless or not at work, and are struggling to live of minimal benefits. So if this basic income is introduced, I feel that less people will be homeless and can live their lives normally.

attributes.action: Put a cap on how many clients carers/nurses can supply care to in healthcare.
attributes.background: In nurseries there is a ratio of 1 nursery nurse per 3 children depending on age. I want the same for the elderly. 1 carer for 4 clients needing care. 1 nurse for 5 clients. This obviously is just an estimate, it depends on other factors and should be looked into.

attributes.action: Scrap the DBS system because most immigrants have no past record.
attributes.background: As a graduate in International Politics/Security I think its wrong for the British people to be penalised when looking for a job just because they have a conviction. When compared to the thousands of immigrants that arrive unlawfully in Britain with no prior record of their past.
attributes.additional_details: Please note, the barred list is a separate issue and is most definitely useful for protecting the vulnerable but just because someone has committed for example financial crime this does not mean that they would hurt someone. I believe this country will lose many of its citizens slowly but surely because one by one people will leave this and travel to where they feel more secure.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for companies to make unsolicited phone calls selling services.
attributes.background: Enough is enough. Constant daily calls both on landline and mobile regarding PPI, accident claim or financial services etc. Also in text form. There should be heavy penalties to stop them as I believe this practice is an invasion of privacy and morally reprehensible.
attributes.additional_details: I have now 'blocked' over 50 telephone numbers on my iPhone but they still keep coming.

attributes.action: Allow dividends paid to a Sipp in drawdown to be withdrawn tax free up to limit.
attributes.background: Dividends from shares are now tax free up to Â£5,000 pa. As a Sipp holder, soon to be in drawdown, I have realised that dividends paid to the Sipp, then withdrawn by the pension holder, will be taxed at marginal rate. Pensioners should have the option to withdraw dividends up to Â£5,000 pa tax free.

attributes.action: Make childhood vaccinations a legal requirement for state-school education
attributes.background: Un-vaccinated children pose a potentially serious risk to the health of other children - particularly those for whom vaccines are less effective or who are medically unable to be vaccinated. Where the failure to vaccinate has no medical basis, other children should be protected.
attributes.additional_details:
Recent years have seen a rise in outbreaks of preventable diseases, which has been at least partially attributed to an increase in parents electing not to have their children vaccinated. These include smallpox (which had been all but eradicated by vaccination), and measles. 
Children are at particular risk, due to the way they play very closely together, and their less developed immune systems.
In Australia, it is already a requirement for receipt of state welfare.

attributes.action: Allow unrestricted work and residency visas for citizens of the commonwealth.
attributes.background: Commonwealth countries such as Canada, New Zealand and Australia have strong historical ties with our nation. Polls suggest all three countries are favourable to the idea, it would help alleviate concerns about mass immigration from countries with dissonant cultural values by offset.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/national/canadians-support-visa-free-travel-between-some-countries-poll/article29204662/?service=mobile

There are multiple sources that support this, I firmley believe it would ease the discord in our society, also it would provide fantastic opportunities for our citizens to learn about the world and enrich our society. I know it would need to be mutual between these nations but I believe we can start a dialogue, also drop NHS surcharge for those nationals.

attributes.action: To scrap the literacy and numeracy tests for those wanting to become teachers.
attributes.background: These tests are preventing future teachers from beginning their training. There are many requirements that need to be met and the schools and universities that provide the training are losing students because of the governments involvement. The training providers don't even approve of these tests.
attributes.additional_details: Last year I was accepted by a school and university. I had completed my degree, achieved the necessary GCSE results, gained 2 years experience of working in education. However, after 3 attempts I failed the numeracy and I am now frozen out for 2 years. After contacting Nicky Morgan's office, I received a reply stating that I am not ready to be a teacher. The questions that are asked are irrelevant to teaching especially when the tests are not relevant to the subjects that trainees want to teach.

attributes.action: UK public to be able to elect the Governor of the Bank of England.
attributes.background: The UK public elect its most influential people, Prime Minister, Chancellor, Home Secretary, Lord Mayor etc as a democracy. The UK public should also be able to elect the Governor of the Bank of England.
attributes.additional_details: The Governor of the Bank of England directly has control over the UK debt, availability of homes, interest rates. The governor also needs to have measurable objectives that his performance can be directly assessed.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for a company to require men to wear a neck tie at work
attributes.background: It's still legal in the UK for a company to require male members of staff to wear neck ties at work against their will. Dress code laws should be changed so that men have the option to wear neck ties at work, if they wish. Current formal work dress codes are out-dated and sexist.

attributes.action: Allow all students access to clean water during school time.
attributes.background: In many school across the country students have been denied access to clean water during school. Even though everyone in our country has clean, fresh running water that is accessible to everyone many school do not allow students to get water during lessons and school. We cannot allow this to happen

attributes.action: Vote that the house has no confidence in the Prime Minister.
attributes.background: He's not fit to hold the office of Prime Minister because he has knowingly put the UK in a position which he believed will undermine the security of the UK, destabilise Europe and the world economy, diminish the capabilities of our intelligence services and will cause mass unemployment.
attributes.additional_details: He has without necessity called for a referendum which could result in the UKs exit from the EU believing it will be ruinous to the nation.  In numerous speeches made by himself and his ministers have made it abundantly clear that he considers a possible exit from the EU would be disastrous for the economic welfare and security of the nation. He's therefore been derelict in his duty to defend the nation against threat by setting in motion a chain of events he believes will harm the UK.

attributes.action: Move parliament to "Skegness". UK Parliament tour seaside resorts during refurb.
attributes.background: Due to 6 years of repairs to the Palace of Westminster,  parliament will be held in a different location. This petition asks the government to discuss touring seaside towns during the repairs. This would utilise our vast holiday park infrustucture, facilitate regenerration and showcase democracy.

attributes.action: Remove London's status as our capital city and move parliament out of London
attributes.background: The purpose of a capital city is to represent our country and its principles, yet London has enjoyed benefits which the rest of the UK has not had (see evidence). Creating a new capital and moving parliament away from London's influence would make it listen to the people it was made to represent.
attributes.additional_details:
Nationalised transport: http://goo.gl/RkcCRH
London's growth: http://goo.gl/dYnaey
Local museums: http://goo.gl/jUJ6ZG
Allowed corruption: http://goo.gl/7axI00

attributes.action: Change the law to stop insurance companies discrimating against people with HIV
attributes.background: Currently people living with HIV, who are healthy and who's health is not at risk can pay astronomically more than those who are not living with the condition when taking out travel insurance. This is compunded by people with the condition being completely discounted from certain insurance cover.

attributes.action: Call on the European Parliament to urge MEPs to engage with constituents
attributes.background: Every four years, EU citizens vote on democratic representatives in the European Parliament (MEPs). Very few people know who their MEP is. If the UK votes to stay in the European Union, the Government must call on the European Parliament to urge MEPs to be more accessible and open to constituents.
attributes.additional_details: Various surveys showing how much people in the UK know about their MEP http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2014/may/10/voters-cant-name-their-mep http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/hands-up-if-you-know-who-your-mep-is-8679242.html

attributes.action: We want a referendum to be held on English membership of the United kingdom.
attributes.background: England would be stronger outside the United Kingdom for the simple reason that Scotland, Wales and Northern island  contribute far less to the Union than they take out. As a result of this England would be stronger outside the UK.

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to charge 3% tax on second homes   (retain for buy to let)
attributes.background: The Government introduced a 3% tax on purchases of second homes (over Â£40k) on 01/04/16. This was following a consultation on applying a 3% tax on buy to let properties. They did this to close a loop hole.  However, they haven't considered the consequences, or included it in any direct consultation.
attributes.additional_details:
This impacts you if you have your own home and purchase another property. This could be to help your parents, your children, your siblings, your friends. It has nothing to do with buy to let.

My sister looked after my parents as a single mum for 15 years, but they have both passed. She needs help to buy a home the Government can't provide. I will have to pay 3% tax on that home I can't afford.

Many more people will be impacted.  Please sign this petition.  It will impact you unfairly one day.

attributes.action: Restrict who can buy UK land and property to uk residents only
attributes.background: It is very concerning that persons who live in other countries and are not resident here are allowed to purchase housing stock, further pushing up prices for uk residents when there are limited resources.

attributes.action: UK should double its Gold because other central banks are buying up all the gold
attributes.background: Gold is money and has been for thousands of years. The money we use today is the faith backed fiat system.People have started to loose faith in the dollar and all other fiat currencies like the Euro.The only way forward is a gold backed currency.
attributes.additional_details:
Interesting websites regarding gold as money

HTTPS://www.hiddensecretsofmoney.com
Http://kingworldnews.com
Http://www.dailyreckoning.co.uk

attributes.action: Introduce topics about gender equality and racial equality to the curriculum.
attributes.background: School is supposed to provide people an education so that they be ready for the 'real world'. What is the point when people aren't educated on social justice matters? The lack of education on racial and gender issues leaves a lot of people growing up with narrow-minded and ignorant opinions.
attributes.additional_details: I know first hand that the majority of boys in school will continue to think it is acceptable to objectify and show little respect to girls. In addition, many of the students will think it is okay to make racist remarks because they don't know any better. There is a platform that reaches these students' minds and can influence their thinking. We need to make it so they won't leave school uneducated on basic respect and social issues.

attributes.background: This will effect so many peoples lives during the construction phase over the next 8-10 years, as buildings, homes and companies are demolished leaving business owners scrambling for new jobs. Wimbledon would also be clogged up with traffic jams. This,ultimately will effect the future of Wimbledon.

attributes.action: Ask Andrea Leadsom to agree to a TOTAL ban on ivory sales including before 1947
attributes.background:
Demand for ivory has seen almost 150,000 elephants lost to poaching in under a decade.
On 21/9/16 Andrea Leadsom announced plans for a ban on sales of modern day ivory, but allowing trade before 1947.
CITES CoP17 taking place in Johannesburg, South Africa from 24 September to 5 October 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
DEFRA will consult on plans for the ban next year. 
Environment Secretary Andrea Leadsom said:
The UK has a strong record as a global leader in the fight against the illegal wildlife trade and Iâm determined to do all we can to bring an end to poaching and ivory trafficking.
"To do all that DEFRA can" would be to have a TOTAL ban on ivory sales before and after 1947.
Therefore I call on Andrea Leadsom to plan for a TOTAL ban on all ivory trade in and out of the UK.

attributes.action: The Government should send a declaration of Secession to the EU immediately
attributes.background: Britain does not need a Trade Deal with the EU, in fact, it will be detrimental.  Art. 50 will lead us into years of negotiation with little to show for it on their terms.  A trade deal will keep also keep us tied to the EU.  We need to declare WTO rules and offset tariffs with savings.
attributes.additional_details: The EU will continue to argue for a Brexit on their terms when it should be on ours.  The UK voted to completely leave the EU and by following Art. 50, we shall be tied to them for years.  A simple declaration of secession will leave the EU with the option of treating the UK as any other 3rd State instead of trying to hang on to us.  Savings will offset any tariffs they choose to impose, or they can choose to work with us tariff free to mutual benefit and we can trade with the World immediately

attributes.action: Request aid from United Nations World Food Programme in reducing malnutrition
attributes.background: Documented cases of child malnutrition are increasing in deprived areas in the UK. Local authorities do not have the resources to cope, and central government funding strategies are exacerbating the situation. Outside help appears to be the only available option.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for schools to force pupils to sing religious songs
attributes.background: It is still legal to let a school punish students (through detentions ect...) for not singing religious songs when the songs doesn't apply to their religion or they're not religious at all... this outdated law should be removed
attributes.additional_details: The law states that religious and non religious schools must take part in some form of collective worship and that it must only be of christian character which isn't reflective of the demographic

attributes.action: Ban all non prescription flea treatment for pets in the UK
attributes.background: With 13 million UK households owning a pet, it's common for people to rely on cheap flea treatment. Some non prescription flea treatments do NOT work effectively and will not kill fleas. Studies find that they may, however, kill your pets.
attributes.additional_details:
Not only do these treatments not work but they may actually be dangerous. 

A simple Google search reveals that hundreds of dogs and cats have fallen victim to the ingredients used in cheaper treatments and hundreds have actually died. 

Whilst it's understandably difficult to afford proper flea treatment, this is the price of having a pet and as their owners, we are fully responsible.

Please sign to make any non prescription flea treatment illegal.

attributes.action: Ban Zero Hour Contracts and ensure all employers offer 10 hours per week minimum
attributes.background: Employers are still taking on staff with zero hour contracts, meaning a large portion of the UK workforce has no idea what their income will be from one week to the next. Not only this, these jobs are often paid at the minimum wage which often makes life very hard for honest working people.
